questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
From the Microsoft Teams admin center, you add an operator to Operator Connect.
You need to enable users for Microsoft Teams Phone.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
//IMG//

discussion.content: Create a valid emergency address, Acquire a number and Assign the number. I do not think numbers can be acquired without an emergency address.

comments.content:
You are incorrect! You can get new number without an emergency address. What is needed is the location/area to get an NPA of your need. The selected answers are correct.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/getting-phone-numbers-for-your-users#:~:text=Admin%20Help.-,Get%20new%20phone%20numbers%20for%20your%20users,-Using%20the%20Microsoft

questions.question_text:
Your company has offices in 10 countries. The company has a tenant dial plan configured for each country.

The company recently opened an office in a new country.

You need to create a new tenant dial plan that meets the unique dialing requirements of the new country.

What should you do?

choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice, select Calling policies, and then select Add
choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Voice, select Phone numbers and then select Add

discussion.content:
New-CsOnlinePSTNGateway and SipSignalingPort are the correct answers. Please refer to this document and Search on "Required" keyword to find all the mandatory parameters need to build the gateway configuration.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/new-csonlinepstngateway?view=skype-ps
It should be ByPassMode for the second option. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/new-csonlinepstngateway?view=skype-ps

comments.content: I am sorry, you are incorrect! -ByPassMode is NOT a required field but the SipSignalingPort is mandatory parameter. Without this you cannot establish a trunk. The selected answers are correct.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You are deploying Direct Routing with media bypass.

You need to define a Session Border Controller (SBC) in Teams.

How should you complete the command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content: Agree, Test-CsEffectiveTenantDialplan takes an additional "-DialedNumber" parameter.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a dial plan named DP1.

You need to assign DP1 to a new Microsoft Teams user named User1. You must verify that the appropriate dial plan and the associated normalization rules assigned to User1.

How should you complete the PowerShell script? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

choices.C: Add the DID range of +14035554300 to +14035554309 to the phone number range.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Phone numbers, select Routing rules, and then select Add a new rule.
choices.B: Set Routing options to Voice application and assign the Reception call queue.
choices.A: Set Routing options to Person in organization and assign the Reception call queue.
choices.E: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, select Phone numbers, select Numbers, and then select Add.
choices.F: Add the DID range of +14035554300 to +14035554329 to the phone number range.

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

The company has a direct inward dial (DID) phone number range of +14035554300 to +14035554329.

Phone numbers +14035554310 to +14035554325 are assigned to Teams users, auto attendants, and call queues.

You need to ensure that when an unassigned number is dialed, the caller is forwarded to a call queue named Reception.

Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents a part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDF
F is chosen here because "If a specified pattern/range contains phone numbers that are assigned to a user or resource account in the tenant, calls to these phone numbers will be routed to the appropriate target and not routed to the specified unassigned number treatment. There are no other checks of the numbers in the range"
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/teams/new-csteamsunassignednumbertreatment?view=teams-ps

also range specified in C is missing few unassigned numbers (last few numbers in the range)

Selected Answer: BDF
The order is D-F-B. The entire number range is taken here, as the registered numbers are excluded from the system.
